metadata.feature_description: Report inappropriate wiki articles or comments to moderators

steps.expected: Successfully logged in with admin privileges
steps.actual: Successfully logged in as SuperUser Account

steps.action: Navigated to Wiki Test page and found Wiki module with articles
steps.expected: Wiki module with article list visible
steps.actual: Wiki module in LeftPane shows 4 articles including Test Article for Search, Test Article for Bookmarks, Test Article for Revision Management, and Test Article for Metadata

steps.action: Clicked on article title to navigate to article detail view
steps.expected: Article detail view with Report button should be displayed
steps.actual: Article detail page loads but displays empty content - no Wiki module content or Report button is rendered on the page

issues: Wiki article detail pages do not render any Wiki modules. The page at /Wiki-Test/Test-Article-for-Search shows only header, footer, and trial notice but no article content or Report button. This appears to be a page template configuration issue where the Wiki Article detail view module is not placed on article subpages.

steps.action: Attempted to access article detail view to find comments section
steps.expected: Article page with comments and Report option for comments
steps.actual: Article detail pages do not render any content, so comments section with Report functionality cannot be accessed

issues: Cannot test Report Comment functionality because the Wiki article detail view does not render on article subpages. The comments section (which includes comment reporting) is part of the Article.ascx control that is not being displayed.

steps.action: Attempted to access Report dialog to test reason selection
steps.expected: Report dialog with 4 reason options (Low Quality, Spam, Doesn't Belong, Other)
steps.actual: Report dialog cannot be accessed because the Report link in Article.ascx is not rendered on any accessible page

issues: Cannot test report reason submission because the Report UI is not accessible. Code review confirms the ReportContent.ascx control has 4 report reasons (Low Quality, Spam, Doesn't Belong, Other with custom text input) but this UI cannot be reached.

steps.action: Attempted to submit a report to verify moderator notification
steps.expected: Report submission triggers notification to moderators
steps.actual: Cannot submit a report because the Report UI is not accessible from any page

issues: Cannot verify moderator notifications because report submission is blocked by the unavailable Report UI. Code review confirms ReportController.cs calls Notifications.Instance.ReportArticle() which sends moderator notifications, but this cannot be verified through UI testing.

observations: Code review confirms the Content Reporting feature is fully implemented in the codebase: Article.ascx contains a Report link at line 109, ReportContent.ascx provides a dialog with 4 report reasons (Low Quality, Spam, Doesn't Belong, Other), and ReportController.cs has SubmitReport and SubmitCommentReport API endpoints.
The Notifications.cs class confirms report notifications are sent to moderators with the PermissionCode and ModeratorsPermissionKey.
ScoringActions for FlaggedArticle and FlaggedComment are logged when reports are submitted, indicating gamification/reputation tracking exists.

The Wiki Test page has Wiki modules configured in the index view showing article listings, but article detail subpages (e.g., /Wiki-Test/Test-Article-for-Search) do not have any Wiki modules placed on them, rendering the article content area empty.

This appears to be a page template or module configuration issue rather than a code bug - the Wiki Article detail view module needs to be configured to display on article subpages for the Report functionality to be testable.
